quote: The practice of forgiveness is our most important contribution to the healing of the world.
author: Marianne Williamson

quote: The lesson is that you can still make mistakes and be forgiven.
author: Robert Downey

quote: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: I believe forgiveness is the best form of love in any relationship. It takes a strong person to say they’re sorry and an even stronger person to forgive.
author: Yolanda Hadid

quote: Forgiveness is the fragrance that the violet sheds on the heel that has crushed it.
author: Mark Twain

quote: To err is human; to forgive, divine.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Forgiveness is the final form of love.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: Forgiveness is a virtue of the brave.
author: Indira Gandhi

quote: Sweet mercy is nobility’s true badge.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Forgiveness is that subtle thread that binds both love and friendship.
author: George Foreman

quote: We think that forgiveness is weakness, but it’s absolutely not; it takes a very strong person to forgive.
author: T.D. Jakes

quote: At that moment, something shifted sweetly inside him. It was forgiveness, beautiful and effortless and complete. For Louie Zamperini, the war was over.
author: Laura Hillenbrand

quote: I couldn’t forgive him or like him, but I saw that what he had done was, to him, entirely justified. It was all very careless and confused.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: As you from crimes would pardoned be,Let your indulgence set me free.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Any fool can criticize, complain, and condemn—and most fools do. But it takes character and self-control to be understanding and forgiving.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: I wondered if that was how forgiveness budded; not with the fanfare of epiphany, but with pain gathering its things, packing up, and slipping away unannounced in the middle of the night.
author: Khaled Hosseini

quote: Love may forgive all infirmities and love still in spite of them: but Love cannot cease to will their removal.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: I tried to do as she would wish it. The Lord will pardon me and excuse the conduct of them He sent me.
author: William Faulkner

quote: Why should the injured, the still bleeding, bear the onus of forgiveness?
author: Delia Owens

quote: There is no forgiveness. For women. A man may lose his honor and regain it again. But a woman cannot. She cannot
author: Cormac McCarthy
